input.title: Ask your question
input.label: What decision do you need to make now?
input.placeholder: e.g., How is vaccination coverage by neighborhood and what should we prioritize this week?

vaccination.title: Vaccination coverage
vaccination.subtitle: Goal by age group from SI-PNI data

history.title: Recent consultations
history.empty: New questions will appear here right after submission.

responses.vaccination: Consolidated vaccination coverage is {{coverage}}% supported by {{aps}}% APS reach. Predictive monitoring flags outbreak risk in {{outbreak}}% of tracked neighborhoods if actions are not escalated this week.
responses.budget: FNS transfers total R$ {{transfers}}M this month and align with the plan. Still, {{aps}}% APS coverage requires stronger home care to sustain production.
responses.occupancy: Bed occupancy sits at {{occupancy}}% with an average stay of {{stay}} days. The regulation queue holds {{queue}} cases that must be redistributed to avoid clinical bottlenecks within 48 hours.
responses.surveillance: We found {{riskAreas}} territories at high risk with {{outbreak}}% outbreak probability. Activate the integrated APS + Surveillance plan immediately.
responses.telemedicine: Telemedicine now covers {{coverage}}% of priority citizens, supporting 11.8k digital visits/day and reducing ER pressure by {{reduction}}%.
responses.supply: Supply models warn of a {{risk}}% risk of {{medication}} shortage within two weeks if redistribution and procurement are not triggered.
responses.news: Latest headlines highlight {{first}} ({{firstSource}}) and {{second}} ({{secondSource}}). Monitoring and comms playbooks are aligned for quick responses.
responses.default: The combined picture shows {{aps}}% APS coverage, {{occupancy}}% hospital occupancy, and {{supplyRisk}}% supply risk. Coordinate joint actions within 24 hours.

vaccination: Deploy mobile vaccination teams to the highest-risk neighborhoods
Send segmented Minha Saúde Angra campaigns to households with children under 5
Update the mayor’s dashboard with heatmaps and neighborhood targets
budget: Reallocate 3% of the budget to active surveillance in critical territories
Release an extra telemonitoring batch for high-risk hypertensive patients
Validate financial reporting against the agreed indicators
occupancy: Activate the safe discharge protocol with APS support
Prioritize elective surgical regulation to partner hospitals
Reserve step-down beds to increase clinical turnover
surveillance: Mobilize field agents for visits within 24h
Send educational alerts to high-risk neighborhoods
Coordinate community clean-up with Civil Defense support
telemedicine: Extend evening teleorientation slots in Monte Líbano and Piracicamirim
Push targeted reminders via Minha Saúde Angra and local radio
Feed telemonitoring summaries into UPA records in real time
supply: Trigger central procurement to rebuild stock within 10 days
Redistribute surplus from Pauliceia and Centro pharmacies
Configure daily critical-consumption alerts in the AI console
news: Prepare a technical note with official data to reinforce transparency
Align spokespeople and messaging with the communications office
Publish a public dashboard snippet on the city website within two hours
default: Hold an APS + hospital tactical huddle to align flows
Issue a unified briefing to the mayor summarizing priorities
Set hourly monitoring for the critical indicators

prompts.vaccination: What is neighborhood vaccination coverage and what should we prioritize this week?
prompts.bedManagement: How is occupancy by service and which beds should be freed for regulation?
prompts.financial: Do FNS transfers and SUS billing cover this month’s operating costs?
prompts.outbreak: Which neighborhoods carry the highest arbovirus risk and which plan must we launch?
prompts.telemedicine: How is telemedicine reducing queues and how can we boost adherence?
prompts.news: What are the latest health headlines in Piracicaba and what action should the city take?

header.title: Electronic Health Record
header.subtitle: Electronic Health Record System – SBIS-CFM certification and Law 13.787/2018 compliance
header.highlightBody: Manage the certified Electronic Health Record System (S-RES) with SBIS-CFM seal. Monitor e-prescriptions, ICP-Brasil digital signatures, clinical notes, reports, exams, and FHIR interoperability. Ensures compliance with Law 13.787/2018, CFM Resolution 1821/2007, and security guidelines. Essential to eliminate paper, reduce medical errors, improve care quality, and support clinical and administrative audits.

bestPractices.title: Best practices
items: Store access tokens securely (Supabase Vault or equivalent).
Use MCP Server to schedule jobs and handle rate limits.
Normalize payloads into the patient_device_metrics schema with versioning.
Allow patients to control consent granularly (LGPD/GDPR).
